means: 抛锚( anchor的过去式和过去分词 )
担任（电视节目等的）主持人

sentence.Network_en: The boat was anchored off the northern coast of the peninsula.
sentence.Network_cn: 这艘船停泊在离该半岛北部海岸不远的地方。

sentence.Network_en: His basic outlook remains anchored in the liberal tradition.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的基本观念依旧扎根于自由主义传统。

sentence.Network_en: The child seat belt was not properly anchored to the car.
sentence.Network_cn: 儿童坐椅的安全带并未在车上固定到位。

entry.def: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water in order to make it stay in one place.

example.ex: We could anchor off the pier...
example.tran: 我们可以在码头附近下锚停泊。

entry.def: If you anchor an object somewhere, you fix it to something to prevent it moving from that place.

example.ex: The roots anchor the plant in the earth...
example.tran: 根部使植物固定在土壤中。

example.ex: The child seat belt was not properly anchored to the car.
example.tran: 儿童坐椅的安全带并未在车上固定到位。

entry.tran: 固定桩；系缚物；支柱；靠山
entry.def: If one thing is the anchor for something else, it makes that thing stable and secure.

example.ex: He provided an emotional anchor for her...
He remains the anchor of the country's fragile political balance.
example.tran: 他仍然是维系该国脆弱的政治平衡的支柱。

entry.tran: 与…有紧密联系;使扎根;使固守
entry.def: If something is anchored in something or to something, it has strong links with it.

example.ex: A united Germany must be firmly anchored in NATO if Europe is to remain stable...
example.tran: 欧洲要保持稳定，德国必须统一并固守北约。

example.ex: His basic outlook remains anchored in the liberal tradition.
example.tran: 他的基本观念依旧扎根于自由主义传统。

entry.tran: 主持（电视或电台节目，尤指新闻节目）
entry.def: The person who anchors a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it and acts as a link between interviews and reports which come from other places or studios.

example.ex: Viewers saw him anchoring a five-minute summary of regional news.
example.tran: 观众看见他主持一个5分钟的地方新闻摘要节目。

example.ex: ...a series of cassettes on the Vietnam War, anchored by Mr. Cronkite.
example.tran: 克朗凯特先生主持的关于越南战争的系列节目录像带

entry.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目主持人
entry.def: The anchor on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.

example.ex: He worked in the news division of ABC — he was the anchor of its 15-minute evening newscast.
example.tran: 他在美国广播公司的新闻部工作——他是晚间15分钟新闻播报的主持人。

entry.def: If a boat is at anchor, it is floating in a particular place and is prevented from moving by its anchor.

example.ex: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
example.tran: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

entry.def: When the people on a boat drop anchor or cast anchor, they drop the boat's anchor into the water in order to prevent the boat from moving.

example.ex: We dropped anchor in a sheltered spot.
example.tran: 我们在一个能够遮风挡雨的地方下了锚。

entry.def: When the people on a boat weigh anchor or up anchor, they pull the anchor of the boat out of the water so that they can sail away.

auth_sentence.content: The party is completely anchored in one family.
auth_sentence.res_content: The party is completely anchored in one family.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The party is completely anchored in one family.

auth_sentence.content: It is a helix of metal anchored in a rounded wooden handle.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a helix of metal anchored in a rounded wooden handle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a helix of metal anchored in a rounded wooden handle.

auth_sentence.content: Crowe anchored the night with her penetrating tone and her incisive diction.
auth_sentence.res_content: Crowe anchored the night with her penetrating tone and her incisive diction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Crowe anchored the night with her penetrating tone and her incisive diction.

Sentence.sentence: Unlike floating ice shelves which have little impact on sea level when they break up, the ice sheet is anchored to bedrock will blow the sea surface.
